Evaluation ResultsÔÉÅ

Evaluation results are represented as a two-dimensional table (matrix). The rows of the matrix are stateful functions and the columns are evaluation points.

Every cell of the matrix is an object with four float-type values:

  • \(l\) number of paths used in the computation

  • \(\mu\) mean value

  • \(\sigma\) standard deviation

  • \(k\) skewness

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skewness

Normally \(l\) should be equal to \(m\) (number of paths). But it can be smaller, as the MonteCarloEngine will automatically exclude in the statistics computation values which were evaluated to NAN values.
